Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, showing two(?) lines of text (greek?) on the outside of the vessel, written in black ink. The vessel itself was not cleaned, it shows a lot of traces of mud as well as white accretions at the in- and outside as well as salt crystals. The sherd is part of a closed vessel with a red slip on the outside, partly burnished, the surface of the inside is not recognizable anymore.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 72)
